section.audio_text: The SPEED TRIM FAIL light on the 737 MAX is similar in function to the 737NG. Illumination of the SPEED TRIM FAIL light on the 737NG indicates: Failure of the Speed Trim function in the Speed Trim System.
Illumination of the SPEED TRIM FAIL light on the 737 MAX indicates: Failure of the Speed Trim function in the Speed Trim System OR Failure of the MCAS function in the Speed Trim System.
If one function fails, both functions (the Speed Trim function and MCAS function) are inoperative for the remainder of the flight.

On the 737 MAX, if the left and right angle of attack (AOA) sensors disagree by 5.5 degrees or more with the Flaps UP, or if the maximum command limit is reached, the amber SPEED TRIM FAIL light illuminates and the Speed Trim System is inoperative for the remainder of the flight.
Refer to the SPEED TRIM FAIL Non-Normal Checklist.
